title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 1 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: ex-teacher and church spokesman denies abusing boy , saying he `` got married '' .
police investigate whether an injured dog was thrown from a vehicle on the a38 .
reports involving indecent images of children 'nearly doubles in three years ' .
portholland diver death : group from west sussex .
police consider terrorism materials search extension .
'sticky situation ' after helen glover 's olympic medal dropped by fiance .
the duke & duchess of cambridge start a two-day visit to cornwall & the isles of scilly .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on friday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: tricorn style wars break out in bbc newsrooms
text: spotlight anchor justin leigh and producers claire hawke and louise walter are the latest bbc staff members to don a tricorn in anticipation of the launch of the second series of poldark on bbc one on sunday .

documents.title: latest weather : cloud increasing , but some sunny spells on friday
text: it will be dry through this evening , but cloud will increase from the northwest .
after midnight , some showery rain will arrive , with the odd heavier burst possible .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
it will be fairly cloudy for much of friday , with occasional light rain .
that said , some sunny intervals are likely to develop through the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines in devon and cornwall
text: latest headlines in devon and cornwall
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: university gave 'no guarantees about future use of rolle campus '
text: plymouth university says it gave no guarantees `` about future use '' of its rolle campus in exmouth after a community group says it was disappointed not to be given the chance to take it over .
the exeter royal academy for deaf education is moving to the former teacher training site , which has been disused for eight years .
rolle exmouth ltd had been using a building for a local businesses hub and had hopes of a permanent future there .
the university said : `` we are fully satisfied that we have arrived at a highly positive solution for the rolle campus , its new owners , and , we believe , for exmouth . ''
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: looe harbour documents are put in the frame
text: people interested in seeing old maps and documents discovered in a cornish harbour office will not have to wait until they are available online because some have been put up in the harbour master 's office .
the centuries-old documents , found in looe , are being been digitally photographed with the ultimate aim of putting the archive online .
however , retiring harbourmaster jeff penhaligon , who found the documents stored in bin bags , has had some framed and they are on display .
the find includes dozens of old maps , charts and books relating to the port 's history , including its original lease .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: teenagers 'lucky not to have been hurt ' on homemade raft
text: lifeguards say a group of teenagers are lucky not to have been seriously injured after they took to the sea off fistral beach in newquay on board a homemade raft .
the alarm was raised early yesterday evening when the trio , two males and a female , were spotted in the water .
the group were not in trouble but soon realised they did n't have a plan to get back to shore safely .
the rnli said they 'd launched the vessel from nearby rocks .
the lifeguards transported the three people ashore and dismantled the raft .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: injured dog 'thrown from car '
text: police are investigating reports that a dog found injured was thrown from a vehicle on the a38 .
officers said they were called to kennford services on the dual carriageway , near exeter , at about 14:00 `` after initial reports of a dog being thrown '' .
a black king charles spaniel was found with suspected broken legs and taken to a vets for treatment .
police appealed for witnesses , saying : `` at this time , police only have third-hand reports of how the dog came to be on the road and how it sustained its injuries . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: sadness at closure of exmouth seafront crazy golf course after 40 years
text: it was the end of an era for exmouth seafront when the jungle fun attraction and arnold palmer putting course closed for the last time .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: indecent child images cases : the figures
text: there 's been a sharp increase in devon and cornwall in the number of reports to police involving possessing of indecent images of children , according to freedom of information requests made by children 's charity the nspcc .
the figures reveal :
source : nspcc
across the uk , the total number of recorded crimes for the possession , distribution and production of indecent images of children rose from 4,530 in 2013 to 10,818 in 2015 .
of those cases , 2,031 of the suspects were under 18-year-old .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: temporary bed closures 'not sneaky move to shut community hospitals '
text: an nhs boss has denied that temporary bed closures have been part of `` sneaky '' moves to close community hospitals .
a consultation has begun on plans to close community hospitals in ashburton , bovey tracey , dartmouth and paignton .
health commissioners said they wanted to care for people in the community instead , and needed to make cuts somewhere .
critics said the move would increase pressure on other facilities and increase bed-blocking .
dr nick roberts , of south devon and torbay clinical commissioning group said those beds were temporarily closed due to .
`` patient safety issues .
he said : `` the keys issue is around workforce , so there are some community hospitals where we find it difficult to recruit to have safe nursing numbers .
other aspects are about buildings being fit for purpose . ''
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: the royals hit the surf
text: prince william meeting surf instructors at newquay
the wave project with two vips

documents.title: new academy for deaf site 'will double student numbers '
text: a new site in exmouth will allow the exeter royal academy for deaf education to cater for 160 youngsters , double its current number of students .

the academy , which has been in exeter for nearly 200 years , hopes to be working out of a new facility at rolle campus in exmouth - after taking it over from plymouth university - within 24-30 months .
the site has been vacant for eight years since the university moved its teacher-training facilities to plymouth .
the academy 's current premises on topsham road are to be sold .
discussions with housing developers have already taken place , it is understood .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: getting ready for poldark ? we are !
text: # poldarkcornwall tricorn selfie @ twitterid @ twitterid essential sunday viewing .
reckon @ twitterid + i can pull off the # poldark look ?
# tricorntwins
another # poldark moment as tricorn hats do the rounds in the @ twitterid newsroom .
i could get used to this !
a fine figure of a
oh hel-lo
author: Debbie McCrory
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: repair to helen glover 's olympic gold medal 'quite a mission '
text: fixing penzance rower helen glover 's olympic gold medal , after her fiance dropped it on a concrete floor , was `` quite a mission '' , a gold and silversmith says .
ms glover ( left ) won the women 's pair in rio with partner heather stanning .
she and tv nature presenter steve backshall ( right ) , who met her in 2014 , are due to get married later this month .
bourne end jewellers gold and silversmith richard bull said : `` it was damaged on two edges - on one edge quite badly and the other less badly .
they are pretty heavy and bigger than you think .
they are about 4in in diameter , and must weigh half a kilo . ''
he added he was `` honoured to have been trusted with restoring such a priceless object '' .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: three parking ticket machines stolen
text: a number of parking ticket machines have been stolen in devon and cornwall .

the south west lakes trust said two of its machines were sawn off at the base and taken away : one from roadford lake , near okehampton , on friday night ; and another from trenchford lake , near bovey tracey , on saturday .
one of the trust 's machines was found under a bridge in the launceston area in cornwall , with reports that it appeared to have angle grinder damage on it .
another machine was taken from the harbourside at fowey in cornwall .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: out and about : duke and duchess sign cathedral slates and pull some pints
text: the duke and duchess of cambridge signing a slate @ twitterid
the duke and duchess of cambridge wowing the crowds @ twitterid
eversing like see the hrh
hrh behind the bar at the cornish cyder farm .

documents.title: man 'did not abuse boy because he had just got married '
text: a former teacher and church reader accused of abusing a young boy in the 1970s says he did n't commit the alleged offences because he had just got married and no longer had an interest in young boys .
jeremy dowling , 78 , a former press spokesman for the bishop of truro , is accused of sexually abusing a boy that he met whilst he was working at two churches near bude .
he denies six counts of sexual abuse involving a child and two counts of gross indecency with a child .
the trial , at truro crown court , continues .
author: Eleanor Parkinson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: 'fabulous ' looe harbour documents include original lease
text: a retiring cornish harbour master who discovered hundreds of `` fabulous '' maps , charts and documents by chance in an office says the harbour 's credentials will never be questioned because he found the original act establishing it .
the centuries-old documents were found in bin bags in looe by jeff penhaligon .
they have been digitally photographed with the ultimate aim of putting the archive online .
he said he could n't believe his luck when he found them .
he said : `` some of them are so delicate .
we 've got the original act of leasing the harbour .
no one can argue with us because we can go back donkey 's years .
it 's fabulous . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: community group 'disappointed ' at rolle campus takeover
text: a community group says it is disappointed not to be given the chance to take over the rolle campus in exmouth from plymouth university .
the exeter royal academy for deaf education is moving to the former teacher training site , which has been disused for eight years .
rolle exmouth ltd had been using one of the buildings for a pilot scheme for a local businesses hub , with community events taking place .
chairwoman deborah hallett said the organsiation had been encouraged to give time , effort and up to £ 250,000 in the hope of a permanent future there .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: up close with the duke and duchess of cambridge
text: i 've been keeping interesting company this morning .
the duke and duchess of cambridge began a two-day visit to cornwall and the isles of scilly at truro cathedral this morning .
they were greeted by thousands of well-wishers , some of whom waited for hours to catch a glimpse of the royal couple .
after signing a slate to support the cathedral 's roof appeal , william and kate went on a walkabout .
author: James Churchfield
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: purrington set to stake claim for regular place at argyle
text: ben purrington says he is ready to stake his claim for a regular place in the plymouth argyle side .
the 20-year-old left-back is set to deputise for injured counterpart gary sawyer against cheltenham town .
`` i 've got the opportunity through gary 's injury , so hopefully i can capitalise on that and hopefully keep the position , '' he told bbc radio devon .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: new bampton community centre opened
text: the north devon town of bampton has officially opened its new library and community resource centre .
the town was given funding to renovate an old school building to provide the facility .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: st ives sergeant : 'decisions ca n't be made about individual officers '
text: sgt mike friday , who works in st ives and hayle , is being moved to an office job in camborne in a few months ' time .
campaigners at a public meeting say he is `` integral '' to the community and want to keep him there .
public mtg about future of a st ives sergeant gets heated as @ twitterid say decisions ca n't be about 1 individual

documents.title: what are the arguments around community hospital beds ?
text: as a consultation begins today on plans to close community hospitals in ashburton , bovey tracey , dartmouth and paignton , i look at the arguments surrounding them .
campaigners say :
but , those in favour of closing community beds say :
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: the duke and duchess of cambridge visit cornwall
text: the duke and duchess of cambridge have started a two-day tour of cornwall and the isles of scilly .
this morning they arrived at high cross in truro to meet dignitaries and staff at the city 's cathedral , where they signed a slate in support of an appeal for a new roof .
more than £ 3m is needed to repair it because it 's been in place since the cathedral was completed in 1908 .
it 's the first official visit to cornwall by william and kate who will later visit a project to help disadvantaged children through surfing , before travelling to the isles of scilly tomorrow .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: portholland diver death : tests on scuba cylinders
text: tests are being carried out on scuba diving equipment after a man from west sussex died after getting into difficulty in the sea of cornwall , police say .
the 43-year-old man and a 12-year-old girl were retrieved from the sea at portholland beach after getting into difficulty on tuesday .
the girl was taken to hospital in plymouth but was discharged on wednesday .
the pair were among a group of five on holiday .

insp paul norlund , of devon and cornwall police , said : `` we are carrying out routine tests on the man 's scuba diving cylinders , but this is a routine test and there is nothing to suggest this is anything other than a tragic accident . ''
he added a file was being prepared for the coroner .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest weather : getting cloudier
text: during the afternoon , we will have more cloud , and the sunshine will turn more hazy .
winds will be light mainly south westerly , becoming moderate in the west and around the coasts .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
it will remain quite cloudy overnight with a few showers .
cloud will lower and thicken later in the night , with some patchy rain reaching the far west and islands late in the night .
winds will be moderate south westerly , becoming fresh in the west by morning .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
what does the start of # autumn have in store ?
tomasz has our 10 day forecast jo # byesummer
author: BBC Weather

text: latest travel updates in cornwall

text: two big health stories making the news : plans to close local community hospitals , and the junior doctors ' strike .
have your say .
also , if you were the victim of a crime , would you want to meet the perpetrator ?
there are calls to make it a right .
what do you think ?

have your choices caused you problems ?

documents.title: western power helicopter patrolling devon
text: western power has five patrol helicopters which it uses to monitor power lines .
today our helicopters are patrolling in the # telford # northdevon # cardiff # exeter and # worcester areas .
# wpdspotted

documents.title: redruth to be 'judged on away success '
text: new redruth head coach marek churcher says he will be judging whether the season is a success by how well his side do away from the rec .
the reds recorded an unprecedented nine away wins as they finished fourth in national two south last season .
`` one of the measures for us as a group of players is how we win on the road and how many we win on the road , '' churcher told bbc radio cornwall .
`` we 've got to carry that form forward this year . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: man accused of being a paedophile because his girlfriend looks young for her age
text: a man says he is scared to leave his home after being wrongly labelled a paedophile because his girlfriend looks too young - despite being 32 .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: restorative justice : should victims meet the criminals ?
text: if you were the victim of a crime , would you want to meet the perpetrator ?
we 'll hear from the parents of a young man beaten to death by a gang of teenagers .
ray and vi donovan now believe that restorative justice should be a part of the process , but they did n't always feel like that .
and there is a pair of royal visitors in cornwall today .
call in on 01872 222222 .
author: Martin Bailie
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: search continues for 'stolen ' penlee lifeboat disaster medal
text: an investigation is continuing into the disappearance of a bravery medal posthumously awarded to the coxswain of a lifeboat which lost all eight crewmen in the penlee lifeboat disaster .
it was given to william trevelyan richards , who died when the solomon browne went to the aid of the stricken coaster union star in december 1981 .
a total of 16 people died from the coaster and the lifeboat .
the gold gallantry medal , the highest award for bravery , is missing from the rnli 's head office in poole , dorset .
the charity said police had been informed .
appeal continues for missing penlee lifeboat tragedy medal
whoever has taken this give it back what type of person would do this dreadful
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: devon bowlers become national champions at singles and pairs
text: devon 's sam tolchard has added the bowls england national two-wood singles championship to his collection after an exceptional couple of days at royal leamington spa .
the england international defeated hertfordshire 's bradley coles 17-2 in the final .
together with louis ridout , he has also won the men 's national pairs championship .
the kings bowling club duo defeated herefordshire 's mike ricketts and dan holmes 20-13 .
author: Gordon Sparks
Presenter, BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: good view for royal visit
text: best seats in the house for the royal visit # royals # truro

documents.title: 'keep st ives sergeant ' petition gets 4,000 signatures
text: sgt mike friday , who works in st ives and hayle , is being moved to an office job in camborne in a few months ' time .
campaigners said he was `` integral '' to the community and want to keep him where he is .
a public meeting is discussing the issue .
petition to keep cornish bobby on his w.cornwall beat reaches 4000 signatures ahead of public meeting @ twitterid

documents.title: fury in london : gig club launches first boat
text: the newly-formed london cornish pilot gig club launched its first gig , the fury , last night .
the boat , which comes from falmouth , has already raced in home waters at the world championships on the isles of scilly .
the club has attracted a lot of interest and it 's hoped it could see the start of gig racing on the thames .

documents.title: indecent images of children 'a growing problem ' as cases increase
text: an increase in the number of recorded reports of possessing indecent images of children in devon and cornwall shows `` a growing problem '' and more needs to be done to tackle the issue , the nspcc says .
a freedom of information request from the charity revealed such cases almost doubled in three years , from more than 140 in 2013 to just over 280 in 2015 .

sharon copsey , from the nspcc in the south west , said : `` social network providers and other technology platforms must realise that they are the key enablers of online child sexual abuse and [ must ] make a serious commitment to tackle it . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: 'sticky situation ' after helen glover 's olympic medal dropped by fiance
text: penzance rower helen glover 's olympic gold medal has had to be repaired after her fiance dropped it on a concrete floor .
ms glover ( left ) won the women 's pair in rio with partner heather stanning , defending the title won at london 2012 .
she and tv nature presenter steve backshall , who met her in 2014 , are due to get married later this month .
they live in buckinghamshire .
backshall took the medal to bourne end jewellers .
richard bull , the firm 's head gold and silversmith , said he helped get mr backshall out of `` a sticky situation '' .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: redruth to be 'judged on away success '
text: new redruth head coach marek churcher says he will be judging this season by how well his side do away from the rec .

documents.title: portholland diver death : group from west sussex
text: a 43-year-old man who died and a 12-year-old girl who was taken to hospital after getting into difficulty in the sea of cornwall were from the west sussex area and on holiday , police have confirmed .
the man and girl were retrieved from the sea by members of the public at portholland beach after getting into difficulty on tuesday .
the man was declared dead at the scene .
the girl was taken to hospital in plymouth but was discharged on wednesday .
the man , his partner and her three children , who are all from the west sussex area , were holidaying in the area when the incident happened .
the man , who was from horsham , had been scuba diving with his partner 's daughter when they got into difficulty .
police said it appeared `` to be a tragic scuba diving accident '' and next of kin had been informed .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall
text: latest travel in devon and cornwall
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: deaf academy agrees deal to take over exmouth campus from plymouth university
text: the exeter royal academy for deaf education has agreed a deal to take over rolle campus in exmouth from plymouth university .
the site has been vacant for eight years since the university moved its teacher-training facilities to plymouth .
contracts have been exchanged , and it is hoped the purchase will be completed by the end of the year .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: harbour car park ticket machine stolen
text: a harbour car park ticket machine in cornwall has been stolen in what has been described by a town harbour master as a `` well thought-out operation '' .
fowey harbour master paul thomas said the raid appeared to have been timed after the machine received lots of takings over the bank holiday weekend .
he added that , as well as money lost from payments , the machine would cost about £ 6,000 to replace .
he said that police had been informed .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: men arrested after ellacombe robbery at gunpoint were from torquay and paignton
text: two men from torquay who were arrested following a robbery at gunpoint in the ellacombe area of the town have been bailed , while a paignton man also arrested in connection with the incident remains in custody .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: bring me sunshine in your smile , or a smile in the sunshine
text: can you see the smiley face of sunshine that greeted me in truro on the way to work this morning ?
a couple of cars were perfectly parked for their windows to create it .
we 're always on the look-out for interesting to share .
if you have any , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: harbour maps and documents found in bin bag archived for posterity
text: hundreds of maps and charts discovered by chance in a cornish harbour office are being archived for future generations .
the centuries-old documents , found in looe , have been digitally photographed with the ultimate aim of putting the archive online .
retiring harbourmaster jeff penhaligon , who 's been overseeing the project , said he could n't believe his luck when he found the documents stored in bin bags .
the find includes dozens of old maps , charts and books related to the port 's history .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: transfer deadline day august 2016 : completed deals
text: the summer transfer window has closed in england and scotland , and bbc sport has listed every signing from a busy deadline day here .
signings confirmed in may , june and july can be found on the relevant pages , while you can see who each club has released on our dedicated page .
for all the latest rumours check out the gossip page and , for all the manager ins and outs , see our list of current bosses .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: poldark star aidan turner says he 'sexed up ' scything
text: the new series of the hit drama poldark returns to bbc one this weekend .
leading man aidan turner spoke to bbc breakfast 's louise minchin about scything , surfing and spying .
you can see the interview here .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: meeting to discuss future of st ives sergeant
text: a public meeting is being held in st ives today as a result of a campaign to stop a police sergeant being taken off the beat .
sgt mike friday , who works in st ives and hayle , is being moved to an office job in camborne in a few months ' time .
campaigners said he was `` integral '' to the community , and 3,000 people have signed petition to keep him where he is .
police commissioner alison hernandez said she was excited the community had been stirred by policing issues .
3000 people have signed petition to keep a police sergeant on the beat in west cornwall- public meeting later today
but are the residents of st ives wanting any sergeant or just this particular one ?
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: sale fears over hotels for blind people
text: thousands of blind people may lose the use of three specially adapted hotels , including one in devon , after a charity operator said it was planning to sell them .
action for blind people said it could not afford to keep the hotels running .
it wants to offload the cliffden in teignmouth ( the lauriston in weston-super-mare and windermere manor in the lake district .
losing the cliffden with its facilities for blind and visually impaired would be `` devastating '' , one visitor said .
author: Jonathan Morris, BBC News Online

documents.title: power cut in buckfastleigh
text: we apologise we have a # powercut at # buckfastleigh # tq11 and the surrounding area .
engineers estimate 13:00 to restore the power .

documents.title: 'killer slugs ' on their way to devon
text: `` killer slugs '' are heading to the westcountry , which could spark trouble for gardeners .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: offences involving indecent images of children 'nearly doubles in three years ' .
text: there 's been a sharp increase in the number of reports involving the possession of indecent images of children in devon and cornwall .

a freedom of information request from the children 's charity , the nspcc , has revealed that the number of reports involving indecent images recorded by police in both counties has almost doubled in the last three years , from more than 140 in 2013 to just over 280 in 2015 .
the charity is calling for the police to be given greater resources to tackle the growing threat and has pointed to the internet as one reason for the rise .
author: BBC Spotlight

text: lots of activity @ twitterid today for @ twitterid @ twitterid exhibition of historical banners @ twitterid

documents.title: community hospitals closure plans consultation begins
text: a consultation begins today on plans to close community hospitals in ashburton , bovey tracey , dartmouth and paignton .
health commissioners said they wanted to care for people in the community instead , and needed to make cuts somewhere .
there are also plans to reduce the number of minor injury units .
critics said the move would increase pressure on other facilities and increase bed-blocking .
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: police consider terrorism materials search extension
text: a decision on whether to extend a search for terrorism-related materials in devon into a second weekend will be made by tomorrow , devon and cornwall police say .
officers began searching woodland at exminster , near exeter , last wednesday , following the arrest of a royal marine on sus of being involved in preparing for acts of terrorism .
police now have until 7 september to question him .
a house in the town was also searched .
officers began the operation following the discovery of two arms dumps in northern ireland .
they 're thought to be linked to dissident republican paramilitaries .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: latest weather : sunny spells throughout the day
text: we 'll see another bright start across devon this morning and the sunny spells will continue throughout the day .
it 'll feel pleasant too , especially in the sunshine .
maximum temperature : 21 deg c ( 70 deg f )
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for thursday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live
